data.title: Los Angeles Lakers Roster
data.meta_description: Los Angeles Lakers scores, news, schedule, players, stats, rumors, depth charts and more on RealGM.com
data.text:
Andrew Bynum was selected as the #10 pick in the First Round of the 2005 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Andrew Bynum signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 6, 2005.

Brian Cook was selected as the #24 pick in the First Round of the 2003 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Brian Cook signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 5, 2003. Brian Cook signed a multi-year extension with the Los Angeles Lakers on October 31, 2006.

Jordan Farmar was selected as the #26 pick in the First Round of the 2006 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Jordan Farmar signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 5, 2006.

Ronny Turiaf was selected as the #7 pick in the Second Round of the 2005 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Ronny Turiaf signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on January 17, 2006.

Sasha Vujacic was selected as the #27 pick in the First Round of the 2004 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Sasha Vujacic signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 20, 2004.

Luke Walton was selected as the #3 pick in the Second Round of the 2003 NBA Draft by the Los Angeles Lakers. Luke Walton signed a multi-year contract with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 8, 2003. Luke Walton re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the Los Angeles Lakers on August 8, 2005.

Kwame Brown was acquired in a sign and trade by the Los Angeles Lakers from the Washington Wizards on August 2, 2005.

Maurice Evans was acquired in a trade by the Los Angeles Lakers from the Detroit Pistons on June 28, 2006.

Chris Mihm was acquired in a sign and trade by the Los Angeles Lakers from the Boston Celtics on August 6, 2004.

Lamar Odom was acquired in a trade by the Los Angeles Lakers from the Miami Heat on July 14, 2004.
